channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2024 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Baltimore bridge collapses after ship collision
item.description: Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed early Tuesday after it was struck by a large ship, according to video obtained by CNN. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Devastation in Gaza as Israel wages war on Hamas
item.description: The UN Security Council has passed a resolution calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza after the US abstained from the vote. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Trump can pay smaller bond in civil fraud case as judge sets April date for hush money trial
item.description: In the civil fraud case, an appeals court ruled former President Donald Trump can pay a smaller bond. In the criminal hush money trial, a judge said jury selection is now set for April 15. Follow here for the latest live news updates.

item.title: Shohei Ohtani says he never gambled on sports
item.description: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani on Monday said he never bet on baseball or any other sport and said his interpreter Ippei Mizuhura had stolen money from his account.

item.title: How a medication abortion, also known as an 'abortion pill,' works
item.description: An expert in medication abortion describes how mifepristone and misoprostol work and what to expect after using these 'abortion pills.'

item.title: March 25 Moscow concert hall attack
item.description: Four suspects in the Crocus City Hall attack that left at least 139 people dead in Moscow have been charged with committing a terrorist act. They are facing possible life imprisonment.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description:
March 26, 2024
Today on CNN 10, we cover the antitrust lawsuit aimed at tech giant Apple, led by the US Department of Justice and more than a dozen states, shining a spotlight on the brand's unique strategies that could be weeding out competitors. Then, CNN's Kristie Lu Stout takes us to Hong Kong, where she breaks down another new national security law and how it affects this unique city. Finally, watch waiters race the cobblestone streets of Paris holding trays full of items. All that and more on this episode of CNN 10.

item.title: March 24 Moscow concert hall attack
item.description: Four suspects in the Crocus City Hall attack that left at least 137 people dead in Moscow have been identified and detained.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description: March 25, 2024

item.title: March 23, 2024 Shooting at Moscow concert venue leaves over 130 dead
item.description: More than 130 people were killed after armed attackers stormed a popular concert venue complex near Moscow and opened fire.

item.title: Shooting at Moscow concert venue leaves at least 60 dead
item.description: At least 60 people were killed after armed attackers stormed a popular concert venue complex near Moscow and opened fire. Follow here for live updates.

item.title: Senate passes funding bill to avert partial government shutdown
item.description: The Senate passed the $1.2 trillion funding package early Saturday after a last-minute agreement, averting a partial government shutdown.

item.title: March 22, 2024 - Catherine, Princess of Wales, says she has cancer
item.description: Catherine, Princess of Wales, disclosed Friday she has been diagnosed with cancer and is in the "early stages" of treatment.

item.title: March 22, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will conduct a ground offensive into the southern Gaza city of Rafah even without US support.

item.title: Al Gore Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Al Gore, an environmental activist, and 45th vice president of the United States.

item.title: Apple Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Apple, Inc. and learn more about the maker of iPhones, iPads and Mac computers.

item.title: William Shatner Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the life of actor William Shatner.

item.title: March 21, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The US-proposed resolution on Gaza, which calls for a ceasefire, will be brought to a vote in the UN Security Council on Friday morning, a US official said Thursday.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description:
March 22, 2024
Today on CNN 10, we answer your questions with top tips ahead of the total solar eclipse that's expected to darken skies across the US. Then, in the final stretches of Women's History Month, we profile two women -- a courageous climber and a prominent publisher -- who moved mountains as 'first females' to accomplish extraordinary feats. Finally, our Coy Wire meets Louis Rees-Zammit, a 23-year-old rugby rockstar who's leaving it all behind to chase his dream of playing an entirely different sport...American football. All that and more on this episode of CNN 10.

item.title: US sues Apple in antitrust lawsuit
item.description: The Justice Department has filed a blockbuster antitrust lawsuit against Apple on Thursday. Follow here for the latest.

item.title: March 20, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Negotiations to secure an immediate ceasefire tied to the release of hostages held by Hamas are "getting closer" to a deal, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description:
March 21, 2024
Today on CNN 10, we cover a historic hike in interest rates announced by the Bank of Japan, ending an era of negative interest rate policy on the island nation. Next, we dig into the lengthy and complicated legal back and forth stemming from Texas' border security squabble with the federal government. Then, meteorologist Elisa Raffa plucks farmers' top tips for protecting your blossoming buds from harsh weather this spring. Finally, "there's no place like home," if you ask Dorothy from "The Wizard of Oz." Her iconic ruby slippers might agree -- now that the FBI has recovered a pair, stolen from a museum in Grand Rapids. All that and more on this episode of CNN 10.

item.title: Stocks surge after Fed indicates three rate cuts still coming this year
item.description: The S&P topped 5,200 for the first time Wednesday after the Federal Reserve said it was still targeting three rate cuts in 2024. Markets had feared hotter-than-expected inflation and jobs data would persuade the Fed to trim its timeline.

item.title: Vladimir Putin Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Russian President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Easter & Holy Week Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Easter and Holy Week.

item.title: Mike Pence Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Mike Pence, the 48th vice president of the United States.

item.title: NCAA Basketball Tournament Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the NCAA Basketball Tournament which takes place each year in March, and learn about March Madness or The Big Dance.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description:
March 20, 2024
Today on CNN 10, we head to Russia where President Vladimir Putin easily won that country's presidential election without any credible opposition. Then, we discuss a recent rise in measles cases and how to best protect yourself. And before you go, we get a possible glimpse of our digital future as we learn about a British startup that creates what they call AI-integrated "Digital Humans", including a virtual DJ who performs around the world. All that and more on this episode of CNN 10.20, 2024

item.title: CNN projects Trump-endorsed Moreno wins key Ohio GOP Senate primary
item.description: The presidential primary season continued Tuesday with another round of multistate contests, including the competitive Ohio Senate GOP primary. Follow here for the latest news updates.

item.title: March 19, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: US officials are hoping to meet with various Israeli and other Middle Eastern officials over the next week.
